alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 6:11PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: A tropical circulation northwest of Saipan continues to gradually develop. As it does this, a southwesterly monsoon will persist across the region through Wednesday afternoon, helping to maintain a rich tropical airmass capable of producing locally heavy showers and a few thunderstorms. Timing: Through Wednesday evening Location: All of the Mariana Islands Rainfall: 4 to 8 inches with locally higher amounts possible Land: Sustained winds of 15 to 25 mph, with gusts to 35 mph will continue through Tuesday night, especially near heavier showers and thunderstorm that develop. Marine: Sustained winds of 15 to 25 knots with gusts to 35 knots will continue through Tuesday night. Seas: 7 to 10 feet are expected to build into the 9 to 12 foot range for Monday afternoon through Wednesday. Surf of 7 to 9 feet for south facing reefs will continue through Tuesday evening, then they may decrease on Wednesday. Surf for west facing reefs in the 7 to 9 foot range will continue through Wednesday, and possibly through Friday night. Impacts: Periods of urban flooding are possible. Minor coastal beach erosion is also possible. Hazardous marine conditions will continue at least through Wednesday, possibly longer.
